title: What are some of the least problematic K-pop idols? Who are the most problematic? - Quora

response.answer_text: Least problematic idols for me are Chaeyoung  Seulgi  Most for me are G-Dragon  Don’t get me wrong, this man is an icon in his own right, but all the appropriation of my culture and blackface doesn’t and will never sit right with me. Jennie  This was hard to say, but Jennie is extremely problematic. I first noticed when I was watching Blackpink content and cam across a video where Blackpink were getting interviewed and the interviewer had gave them gifts and everybody seemed excited, except for Jennie. She even rolled her eyes after opening the gift when she realized it was a phone. I get that people don’t have to smile all the time, but at least be respectful. Another thing I noticed was the quality of her performances for she gave for her solo promotions and for her D4 promotions. In her D4 promotions, she lipsynced a lot and didn’t really put much into the performances. But during her Solo performances, her energy was clearly present, her dancing was on point, and her vocals were mostly stable. And last but not least, the lazy dancing scandal. First of all, before y’all attack me and say the scandal was cleared and she had an injured ankle, the poster of the article and the picture literally states in their bio that they aren’t a reliable site. It also wasn’t confirmed by YG either. The first thing I realized is how they “solved” the situation. YG takes down the video and Jennie starts dancing better. Then when the article came out all it did was confuse me more. The article states that her ankle got injured during their debut. Blackpink have been a group for 4 years. All blinks now that they’ve had breaks. I’ve gotten my arm broken before. It barely took 2 months to heal. Her having an injury for that long and never doing anything to fix it sound like bs to me. Sakura  She literally fatshamed one of her old bandmates then proceeded to act like her twitter was hacked. Yokoyama, AKB’s current(?) captain exposed her for acting as if she sucks at physical activities to get pity and attention from fans. Even a Japanese MC called her out for being one of the fakest females in the whole entertainment industry. She honestly reminds me of ‘The Boy Who Cried Wolf” cause everytime she makes a mistake its hard to know if its truly a mistake or not. imgur.com (clip of her purposely making her team lose during a game.)

please keep in mind that i’m trying to keep my opinions out of this and i’m calling them “problematic” because they’ve done a lot of controversial things that caused a big uproar in either the koreans or the international onlookers, not that they are bad people. they’re problematic as in “stirring up opinions from the public in general based on their actions” not problematic as in “i personally think they’re problematic and no one should like them and here’s why.” you can decide for yourself on what opinion you want to have on these idols, i don’t really care. least problematic: wonpil, day6 jamie park jeongin, skz mostly ateez and seventeen  most problematic (of course, this could just be the stylists or company but i’m taking what they actually said): hwasa and mamamoo in general. blackface, saying slurs, cultural appropriation. they’ve just done a lot of controversial stuff in general and that’s why i’d call them “problematic.” i’m sure they’re nice people, i’m not saying they're mean or bullies, i just don’t agree with their actions. they’re more quiet and (hopefully) educated now, so that’s nice.g-dragon. drug scandals, suspicious military activity, slurs said. a lot of people don’t like his personality, which isn’t really problematic, but people can sometimes misinterpret his dry humor or sarcasm as sincerity and that he’s serious about what he says.woojin. many allegations arising against him right now which i will discuss if someone wants to start an argument, but otherwise he’s a closed case.jessica, ex snsd member. so many scandals and accusations that i really don’t want to get into.

The least problematic idol is Kang Seulgi  She literally hasn’t been in a scandal ever lol (I think). I’m not sure about the MOST controversial since I feel like there are a lot of them (well it a looot but a pretty large number). But there is an idol who went to prison for trying to blackmail an actor, and another member from that same group was allegedly a sasaeng (obsessive fan who stalks, or engages in other behaviour constituting an invasion of the privacy of a Korean idol or other public figure). Their names are Dahee and Trinity. Both from the K-pop girl group, Glam. Glam was a BigHit group, and ever since their controversies, Bighit has never debuted a girl group again. Dahee  She and another actress tried to blackmail actor Lee Byung-hun for the about of $4.2 million. Trinity  She was allegedly a sasaeng fan Leeteuk from Super Junior. She posed as a CEO's daughter and the daughter of a producer to try to meet Leeteuk, and was known as "Cussing Granny" due to her swearing very often and aggressively. For more info, read this👉 8 of the most shocking scandals to rock the K-pop world, Flash from the past: Glam | K-Pop Amino
